alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 21 at 8:59AM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Collier and Broward Counties through 945 AM EST... At 859 AM EST, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Big Cypress National Preserve, or 26 miles northeast of Chokoloskee, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds and winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Miccosukee Indian Reservation, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley, Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, Miccosukee Service Plaza, Big Cypress National Preserve and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and local media for additional updates and possible warnings. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 AM EST for southwestern Florida.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Inland Collier County; Inland Miami-Dade County
